{"akashictome:is_morphing":1b,"akashictome:data":{industrialforegoing:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"industrialforegoing:book_manual",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"industrialforegoing"},Damage:0s},tconstruct:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"tconstruct:book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Materials and You","akashictome:definedMod":"tconstruct","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브Materials and Your)"},mantle:{book:{page:""}}},Damage:0s},immersiveengineering:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"immersiveengineering:tool",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"immersiveengineering"},Damage:3s},mca:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"mca:book_death",Count:1b,tag:{pages:["I couldn't count how many times my family has been blown to pieces by creepers.

How are they still around, you may ask?

Easy! I, dear reader, have discovered a CURE for death itself! And through this book, I can share it with you.","븗Memorials

rWhen a family member dies, they will drop a chest - and inside will be an 븗itemr that was important to them.

This is the key to reviving someone, don't lose it! Only your spouse and children will drop these items.","븗Staff Of Life

rThe Staff is a powerful item that can revive up to 5 people. Place a memorial item on the ground and wave the staff over it. Within moments, your loved one will be fully revived!

","븗Summoning Grim

rUnfortunately, you must obtain the Staff from the Grim Reaper himself.

To summon him, you must build an altar consisting of 3 obsidian columns that are at least 2 blocks high. They may be higher if you like.","븗Summoning Grim pt. 2

r     # # # X # # #
     # # # # # # #
     # # # # # # #
     X # # E # # X

X = Column
E = Emerald
# = Empty","븗Summoning Grim pt. 3

rAfter building the altar, wait until night and light all 3 columns.

When you're ready to fight, light the emerald block and run!","븗Fighting Grim

rGrim is tough. Use full diamond armor, lots of potions, and lots of enchantments.

He can:
- Fly
- Block attacks
- Blind you
- Move your items
- Teleport
","븗Fighting Grim pt. 2

rIf you hit Grim while he's blocking, he will teleport behind you and strike.

Do not try to use arrows or poison, he is immune!

","븗Fighting Grim pt. 3

rWhen Grim is at 븗half healthr he will teleport into the air and begin healing.

While healing, he will summon his minions from the underworld to fight you.","븗Fighting Grim pt. 4

rWhen Grim is healed, he will continue attacking you, but he won't be able to heal again for 3 minutes and 30 seconds.

Each time Grim heals, he will not be able to restore as much health has he did previously."],"akashictome:definedMod":"mca",author:"Ozzie the Warrior",title:"Death, and How to Cure It!",resolved:1b},Damage:0s},rftools:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"rftools:rftools_shape_manual",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"rftools"},Damage:0s},botania:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"botania:lexicon",Count:1b,tag:{knowledge.minecraft:1b,"akashictome:definedMod":"botania",knowledge.alfheim:1b,knowledge.relic:1b},Damage:0s},draconicevolution:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"draconicevolution:info_tablet",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Draconic Evolution Information Tablet","akashictome:definedMod":"draconicevolution","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브Draconic Evolution Information Tabletr)"}},Damage:0s},extrautils2:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"extrautils2:book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Extra Utilities 2 for Blockheads I","akashictome:definedMod":"cookingforblockheads","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브Cooking for Blockheads Ir)"}},Damage:1s},securitycraft:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"securitycraft:sc_manual",Count:1b,tag:{pages:[],"akashictome:definedMod":"securitycraft",author:"Geforce",title:"SecurityCraft"},Damage:0s},conarm:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"conarm:book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"conarm"},Damage:0s},immersiverailroading:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"immersiverailroading:item_manual",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"immersiverailroading"},Damage:0s},cookingforblockheads1:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"cookingforblockheads:recipe_book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Cooking IIr)"}},Damage:2s},cookingforblockheads2:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"cookingforblockheads:recipe_book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Cooking for Blockheads","akashictome:definedMod":"cookingforblockheads2","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브Cooking for Blockheadsr)"}},Damage:0s},rftools1:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"rftools:rftools_manual",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"rftools1"},Damage:0s},guideapi:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"guideapi:bloodmagic-guide",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:definedMod":"guideapi",G-API_Category_Page:0},Damage:0s},thaumcraft:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"thaumcraft:thaumonomicon",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"Thaumonomicon","akashictome:definedMod":"thaumcraft","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브Thaumonomiconr)"}},Damage:0s},mca2:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"mca:book_family",Count:1b,tag:{pages:["Children are our future! Make sure to have as many as you possibly can.

Not only do you get to experience the joy ofraising a child, but once they are past the baby stage, put them to work!","븗Babies

rWhen you are married, simply approach your spouse and offer to 'Procreate'

After a short dance, you'll be the proud owner of a new baby boy or girl!","븗Growth

rBabies take time to grow, make sure to hold them until they are ready, or give them to your spouse to take care of.

Once a baby is ready to grow, you may place it on the ground and it will grow into a child!","븗Adolescence

rChildren will grow slowly from age 4 to 18.

However, the magical properties of Golden Apples are said to accelerate any child's growth. I have yet to try this myself.","븗Chores

rAny child can farm, cut wood, mine, hunt, and fish. You'll need to provide them with the tools they need to do so.

If a tool breaks and the child doesn't have another, they will have no choice but to stop working.","븗Greed

rIf you notice your child has a Greedy personality, be careful!

Greedy children are known to steal away items that they may pick up while doing chores.","븗Mining

rA special note on Mining here, most children have a peculiar ability to search for and locate ores underground.

This activity damages any pickaxe they may have in their inventory.

","븗Adulthood

rAs sad as it may be, children will eventually grow into adults. Once they are adults, they will no longer work for you.

Adults can be married off by using Matchmaker's Rings, or they will eventually get married on their own."],"akashictome:definedMod":"mca2",author:"Leanne the Cleric",title:"Managing Your Family Vol. XI",resolved:1b},Damage:0s},mca1:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"mca:book_romance",Count:1b,tag:{pages:["븗Introduction

rInteraction is key to building relationships and finding the love of your life.

I've happily written this book in order to share my knowledge of interaction, love, and, unfortunately, divorce, to anyone who may need a little push in the right direction.","븗Personalities

rWhen speaking to any villager, you'll notice they have a personality.

Pay close attention to this. I have outlined each personality's quirks here. Each personality has a particular category they fall into (1-3).","븗Personalities pt. 2
r븗Athletic (2): rRuns faster
븗Confident (3): rHits harder
븗Strong (3): rDoubled attack damage
븗Friendly (1): rGains hearts faster
븗Curious (2): rFinds more when working
븗Peaceful (1): rWill not fight
","븗Personalities pt. 3
r븗Flirty (2): rBonus to all interactions
븗Witty (2): rAppreciates jokes
븗Sensitive (1): rEasily offended
븗Greedy (3): rFinds less when working
븗Stubborn (3): rHarder to gain hearts
븗Odd (2): rN/A
","븗Personalities pt. 4
rThe category shows what a person likes more than others:
븗1:rChatting, Stories
븗2:rJoking, Romance
븗3:rChatting, Shake Hand, Stories

In the case of personality type 3, it is not recommended to attempt jokes or romantic interactions.","븗Moods
rEvery person has a mood, which is always apparent when speaking to them.

Moods can change throughout the day, and determine how likely a villager is to like your interaction, and how many hearts you'll gain.","븗Moods pt. 2
rVillagers in a good mood may have a certain 'glow' about them, and will be easier to interact with.

Villagers in a bad mood may cry, or be visibly angry and be more difficult to interact with.","븗Moods pt. 3
rThe death of a villager seems to put those nearby in bad moods.

Taxing also gradually decreases the moods of everyone nearby.

Gifts and successful interactions are known to boost moods.","븗Interacting
rChoose wisely when interacting with a villager, based on their mood and personality!

If choosing a romantic interaction, be sure that the villager you are talking to likes you a lot.","븗Interacting pt. 2
rDon't be annoying! Talking to someone for too long will bore them, and your interactions may stop succeeding.

If this happens, simply wait a few minutes before trying to talk to them again.","븗Marriage
rTo get married, simply gift a villager a wedding ring once you feel you have reached the highest relationship level.

If you have a lot of friends in the village, you may want to get engaged first!","븗Engagement
rGift an engagement ring before gifting a wedding ring.

All nearby villagers will give you gifts when you get married, but only if you're engaged first!

Villagers that like you more will give you better gifts.","븗Divorce
rUnfortunately, sometimes it is best to split from your spouse and move on.

To do this, you may craft divorce papers with paper, a feather, and ink.

Gift them to your spouse and the marriage will end. They will not be happy!"],"akashictome:definedMod":"mca1",author:"Gerry the Librarian",title:"Relationships and You",resolved:1b},Damage:0s},mca4:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"mca:book_infection",Count:1b,tag:{pages:["Good day, readers! I've written this book so that you may not end up suffering the same fate as I.

Although I caught the infection, I was luckily able to keep all of my mental faculties.","븗What is the Infection?

rI discovered long ago that the zombies that appear at night are actually villagers in the late stages of infection!

Newly infected villagers turn green, are unable to speak, and occasionally try to bite!","븗Curing

rContrary to popular belief, any infected villager can be cured.

You must first weaken the villager or zombie with a potion.

Then, immediately feed them a golden apple.","븗Curing pt. 2

rZombies that can be cured often have enlarged heads and noses.

Any other zombies you see unfortunately are too far gone, and cannot be cured.","븗Curing pt. 3

rZombies will take a couple of minutes to be fully cured.

Villagers who were recently infected, though, and haven't had time to degrade into a full zombie, will be cured instantly!","븗Warnings

rVillagers are highly susceptible to infection, and children even more so!

If you carry a baby with you while fighting zombies, there is a chance it can become infected."],"akashictome:definedMod":"mca4",author:"Richard the Zombie",title:"Beware the Infection!",resolved:1b},Damage:0s},mca3:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"mca:book_rose_gold",Count:1b,tag:{pages:["븗Warning!
TOP SECRET

rThis manual is the property of William Mining Co.

If you are not a William Mining Co. employee, please refrain from reading this manual and return promptly to William the Miner.","Ah, rose gold - a lovely combination of silver, copper, and gold that smelts into a pinkish orange metal.

Most use it as an alternative to gold for crafting rings as it is much less expensive.

However, it has some interesting qualities that are easy to miss.","븗Creating Dust

rRose gold, once smelted, can be crushed into a fine dust.

Look closely at rose gold dust in bright light, and you'll see shiny flecks of pure gold!

","븗Washing Dust

rWith a little work, we can actually extract the gold from the dust and create pure gold ingots. Simply mix dust with a bucket of water.

The lighter silver and copper components will wash away, leaving you with about 6 smaller piles of gold dust.","븗Extracting Gold

rArrange 9 piles of dust on your crafting table, and if you're lucky, you'll find a gold nugget in one of them!

And of course, once you have 9 gold nuggets, you'll be able to craft them into a solid gold ingot."],"akashictome:definedMod":"mca3",author:"William the Miner",title:"On Rose Gold",resolved:1b},Damage:0s},openblocks:{ForgeCaps:{"customnpcs:itemscripteddata":{}},id:"openblocks:info_book",Count:1b,tag:{"akashictome:displayName":"World Domination with OpenBlocks","akashictome:definedMod":"openblocks","akashictome:is_morphing":1b,display:{Name:"rAkashic Tome (브World Domination with OpenBlocksr)"}},Damage:0s}}}

{pages:["[\"\",{\"text\":\"Welcome the ThutTech Manual.\",\"color\":\"dark_green\"},{\"text\":\"\\n\\nThe following pages will describe how to create and operate an elevator system.\",\"color\":\"none\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Getting Started\",\"color\":\"dark_green\"},{\"text\":\"\\n\\nThe first thing you will need to do, is craft several Elevator Blocks, Two or more Elevator Control Blocks, and a Device Linker.\",\"color\":\"none\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"To start with, build the structure which you want to convert into the Elevator.\\n\\nThen right click the first corner of it with your Device Linker, It should get outlined in \"},{\"text\":\"red\",\"color\":\"red\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Next, sneak and right click the other corner, the selected red box will be converted into the Elevator.\\n\\nIf you do not have enough Elevator blocks, it will fail to create, and will tell you how many you need.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Next Shift-Right-Click the elevator with the Device Linker.  This will bind the linker to the Elevator.\\n\\nIf you wish to remove the Elevator, shift right click it with a stick, and it will convert back into the blocks it was made from.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Next place the Control Blocks.\\n\\nThe Control Blocks need to be placed 2 blocks above where the Elevator should stop.\\n\\nRight click the face of the block that you want buttons on with the Device Linker.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Right clicking again with the Linker will cycle through the 4 different pages of buttons.\\n\\nIf you right click the face with a stick, it will toggle that face on and off.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"Control Blocks which are physically touching will be linked to the same floor.\\n\\nYou can make a Controller block into a call controller by shift right clicking the face with an unlinked Device Linker.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"To actually Link the Elevator to the block, shift right click the number you want that floor to be with the Device Linker, and that block will be assigned as that floor.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"To then use, right click the required floor with empty hand, or any item that is not the Device Linker or Stick.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"You may also put chests or Controller Blocks in your Elevator.\\n\\nIf you place a controller block in it, make sure to enable the face before creating the Elevator.\"}]","[\"\",{\"text\":\"The Control Block is compatible with OpenComputers, and has the following Methods available:\\n\\nsetFloor(number)\\ngetFloor(number)\\ncallFloor(number)\\ncall(X/Y/Z)Value(number)\\nget(X/Y/Z)Value()\\ngetFloorYValue(number)\"}]"],author:"Thutmose",title:"ThutTech Manual"}
